algorithm_technique: Iterate and find differing characters, check for at most two differences and correct swap.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if two strings can be made equal with at most one swap.
problem_summary_technical: Compare strings character by character, identify mismatches, and verify if they form a single valid swap.
key_insights: If strings are identical, zero swaps are needed, which is allowed.
If strings differ, there must be exactly two differing character pairs.
The differing pairs must be swappable to make strings equal (e.g., s1[i]=a, s2[i]=b and s1[j]=b, s2[j]=a).
